{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3496984,"name":"Dom1279","username":"tobar23","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/13edae/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T19:12:36.764Z","cooked":"

Our team is trying to see if there is a way to use the built-in encoders that are in a kraken for making set points on, say, something like a thriftybot elevator. If not, what would be your recommendation for a sensor that would be able to do that? Rev through bore encoder?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T19:12:36.764Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":64,"reads":316,"readers_count":315,"score":383.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484323,"topic_slug":"can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator","display_username":"Dom1279","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56823,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator/484323/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3496996,"name":"Patrick McNaughton","username":"PatMcN","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/patmcn/{size}/191694_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T19:24:37.261Z","cooked":"

You can, but the Kraken encoder is relative, so you will need to ensure it boots at zero, or have some way of resetting the position (limit switch, hardstop).

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T19:24:37.261Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":308,"readers_count":307,"score":111.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484323,"topic_slug":"can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator","display_username":"Patrick McNaughton","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54656,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"341 | Co-Captain"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator/484323/2","custom_user_title":"341 | Co-Captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496997,"name":"John Bottenberg","username":"John_Bottenberg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/john_bottenberg/{size}/224569_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T19:25:45.825Z","cooked":"

The built-in encoders work pretty well. I can vouch for the above answer that states that you need to be careful about the zero value.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T19:25:45.825Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":307,"readers_count":306,"score":76.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":484323,"topic_slug":"can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator","display_username":"John Bottenberg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":12266,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3142, 8706, 714←4973←2930←3322←67"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator/484323/3","custom_user_title":"3142, 8706, 714←4973←2930←3322←67","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3497001,"name":"Tauseef Afraz","username":"TFM110","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T19:28:42.834Z","cooked":"

Basically what @PatMcN said, but you should also be aware if your motor is on a gearbox, which you will need to take into account in your code. It will be easier to use the REV or WCP through bore encoder on the hex shaft of the elevator to have a 1:1 connection to the gearbox.

I would highly recommend reading their documentation:

Phoenix 6

Introduction to TalonFX Control

The TalonFX has a variety of open-loop and closed-loop control requests and supports Field Oriented Control. Control Output Types: The TalonFX currently supports three base control output types: Du...

It will walk through all the control modes, how to deal with gear ratios, and what to do with the internal encoders

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T19:32:59.756Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":103.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484323,"topic_slug":"can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator","display_username":"Michael Ray","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://v6.docs.ctr-electronics.com/en/stable/docs/api-reference/device-specific/talonfx/talonfx-control-intro.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Introduction to TalonFX Control","clicks":44}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":34111,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coach 6800 | 27 Alumnus"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator/484323/5","custom_user_title":"Coach 6800 | 27 Alumnus","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3497037,"name":"James Lyon","username":"Lyinlyon","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lyinlyon/{size}/244534_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T20:00:10.258Z","cooked":"

The kraken encoders can work, but there are problems with using a positioning system that is based of motor rotation. The motor encoders will tell you where your elevator should be, which is not always where it actually is. there is backlash from gears and chains as well as a possibly of the elevator rigging slipping slightly. You could use a linear potentiometer instead or add something like a limit switch to the elevator so the encoder can re-zero itself mid-match.

Are you solely using built-in encoders for elevator position control?

  • Yes
  • No
0 voters

Of course!

Since we try using Hardware PID wherever possible, internal encoders are the way to go.

You need a way to find your Zero point, though. In our case we will use limit switch for that. So, when the elevator is all the way down, it trips limit switch and whatever encoder value is at that point - that would be a zero level.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T02:56:37.545Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":22.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":484323,"topic_slug":"can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator","display_username":"Alex Tsekhansky","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":50762,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-you-use-krakens-built-in-encoder-to-have-set-points-on-an-elevator/484323/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3497509,"name":"Jim Barstow","username":"JimB1918","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jimb1918/{size}/166841_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T03:25:24.571Z","cooked":"

We use the internal encoders for their speed, and a fused cancoder for seeding the power on position (and accounting for belt slip, etc)
